title: Cosmos Tours and Cruises seeks to enhance flying experience
text:
Cosmos Tours and Cruises seeks to enhance flying experience 8 July 2015 | By Edward Robertson Save 
Cosmos Tours & Cruises is seeking to make the airport experience pain- free with its 2016 North America and Worldwide brochure. 
The operator is now offering a privately chauffeured home pick up service for anyone booking before December 18 while airport lounge passes are available for anyone booking before August 5. 
Furthermore, an airport hotel offer of £29 per room is available for a one-night pre or post-stay and also includes 14 nights’ airport parking. 
The operator has also introduced several new destinations with both Kentucky and Indochina new for the touring programme while Indonesia has been reintroduced to the programme. 
The nine-day Kentucky Classic is now being featured as a result of the new destinations and leads in at £1,759pp. The price includes return flights from the UK. 
The cruise section has also seen the inclusion of new destinations with Cuba, Barbados and South America making their inaugural appearances with the 12-day Cuban Explorer Cruise leading in at £1,499pp. 
Cosmos is also offering single travellers a choice of 14 tours with no single room supplement to pay. 
Rob Goodwin, head of product, said: “We’re delighted to be able to treat our customers like VIPs and offer the privately chauffeured home pick up service as well as the comfort of an airport lounge. 
“Combined with our choice of new holidays and destinations, we believe customers will be attracted by an upgraded start to their holiday.”
